rqa.tokens.tokenizer.word_tokenizer package¶

Submodules¶

  • rqa.tokens.tokenizer.word_tokenizer.eng module
  • rqa.tokens.tokenizer.word_tokenizer.kor module

Module contents¶

class rqa.tokens.tokenizer.word_tokenizer.WordTokenizer(lang, config, flatten=True, split_with_regex=True)[source]¶

Bases: rqa.tokens.tokenizer.base.Tokenizer

Word Tokenizer

  • Args:
    lang: language [eng|kor]
  • Kwargs:
    flatten: return type as flatten list split_with_regex: post split action. Split tokens that the tokenizer cannot split.
define_split_regex_expression()[source]¶

Apply a small amount of extra splitting to the given tokens, this is in particular to avoid UNK tokens due to contraction, quotation, or other forms of puncutation. I haven’t really done tests to see if/how much difference this makes, but it does avoid some common UNKs I noticed in SQuAD/TriviaQA

load_tokenizer(lang, config)[source]¶
